business.headline: Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade amid a cautious start on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136 points to 84,814.95 around 9:34 am, while the Nifty50 fell 49.95 points to 25,963.50. Sectoral indices were mixed, reflecting the cautious tone among investors.

Why gold, silver prices are falling today and what to expect nextIn India, gold and silver prices also reflected this weakness. As of Tuesday morning, 24-karat gold was priced at Rs 12,343 per gram and Rs 1,23,430 per 10 grams.

PhysicsWallah IPO listing: GMP bounces back, but will investors actually gain?Despite the company's strong brand presence and loyal student base, its IPO received a modest subscription, suggesting that investor sentiment remains cautious.

You're applying for IPOs. But are you funding growth or just promoter exits?The IPO market looks hotter than ever, but the rise of OFS-led offerings reveals a trend most retail investors rarely pause to examine. In Part 2 of The Great IPO Gamble series, we break down what's changing beneath the hype.

US says sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil already cutting Russia's oil revenueThe US Treasury says sanctions on Russian oil majors are lowering revenues and sales. The two largest buyers of Russian oil have been China and India.

Is it possible to improve your credit score without owning a card?Many people assume that a credit card is essential for building a good credit score. But experts say that's not true. With the right financial habits and timely repayments, you can strengthen your credit profile even without owning a card.

India-US trade deal nearing first-phase closure as tariff talks progress: ReportIndia and the US are negotiating a bilateral trade agreement. So far, six rounds of talks have been completed. Both sides have announced plans to finalise the first tranche of the deal by fall of 2025.

The hidden risk in 'diversified' portfolios: Expert explainsThe idea that "more products mean more safety" is common among investors, but it can be misleading. An expert's recent client case shows why portfolios that look balanced may still be exposed to the same underlying risk.

Ever heard of Birkin Bag Hedge Fund? Check the details hereBy focusing on colours and styles that sell the fastest, the fund aims to keep its turnover high and returns steady. Its strategy also reflects how the luxury resale market has matured into a serious business, where handbags are now viewed as long-term investment assets.
Sensex ends 388 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Eternal gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 388.17 points to close at 84,950.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 103.40 points to end at 26,013.45.

Who is Groww founder Lalit Keshre, who just turned billionaire after IPO?Groww, which started in 2016 as a simple idea to make investing easy for young Indians, is now one of the country's most valuable fintech firms.

Anil Ambani offers to give virtual statement in money laundering caseReliance Group chairman Anil Ambani has offered to give his statement through video conference to the Enforcement Directorate, following his absence twice in a FEMA probe related to a 2010 highway project.

US dumps the penny, but some of them can still earn you $5 millionThe US Mint officially ended production of the one-cent coin on November 12. US Treasurer Brandon Beach struck the last penny at the Philadelphia Mint, marking the end of the 232-year-old coin that first entered circulation in 1793.

Is India becoming the world's next big consumption powerhouse?While many economies struggle with sluggish demand, India is quietly powering ahead. A booming middle class, strong domestic spending, and favourable demographics are transforming the country into a consumption force that global brands can no longer ignore.

Why has Bitcoin fallen to $93,000 after touching $126,000 in October?The cryptocurrency has now lost more than 10% in the past week, marking its third straight weekly decline. Bitcoin, along with Ethereum, XRP, Cardano, Solana and other major altcoins witnessed a decline in their prices.

Is your Digital Life Certificate rejected? Here's how you can fix itMany pensioners use the Digital Life Certificate to complete their yearly verification from home, but rejections are still common. If your certificate has been turned down, here's a simple look at why it happens and how you can sort it out.
Explained: Why Tata Motors PV shares crashed 6% todayJLR suffered a major setback in Q2, prompting the company to slash its full-year EBIT margin guidance to 0–2% from the earlier 5–7%.

Which cities are seeing a rise in office spaces, and whyIndia's economic story — steady growth, stable demand, and improving infrastructure — is not only creating demand for office spaces but also enabling developers to capitalise on real estate opportunities.

India to source 10% of annual LPG imports from US under first-ever dealThe contract is India's first-ever structured LPG purchase agreement with the US, and is benchmarked to Mont Belvieu, the key US pricing hub for LPG.

Fujiyama Power Systems IPO Day 3: Check latest GMP, subscription status and moreThe IPO, priced between Rs 216 and Rs 228 per share, aims to raise Rs 828 crore. This includes a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 228 crore by promoters Yogesh Dua and Pawan Kumar Garg.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan and family at Salim-Salma's 61st anniversary, actor greets paps. Watch Salman Khan joined family members and close friends to celebrate the 61st wedding anniversary of his parents, Salim Khan and Salma Khan, in Mumbai on November 17.

Naina Avtr: India's first AI actor debuts in micro-drama 'Naina Avtr', India's first AI actor, was introduced by Avtr Meta Labs. The AI actor now stars in the micro-drama titled 'Truth & Lies'. She appears alongside human actors on the show.

Piyush Mishra slams Bollywood's unnecessary entourage culture, praises south cinema Piyush Mishra criticised the growing trend of actors travelling with oversized entourages in Bollywood, calling it unnecessary and burdensome. He praised the South film industry for its humility and simplicity, recalling how even top directors like Shankar treated him with respect.

TV actor Manya Anand alleges casting couch attempt by Dhanush's manager: I said no Television actor Manya Anand has brought to light allegations of casting couch practices involving Sreyas, a manager associated with actor Dhanush, highlighting recurring inappropriate demands within the film industry.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 4: Ajay's film faces Monday dip Ajay Devgn, Rakul Preet Singh and R Madhavan's 'De De Pyaar De 2' opened to a solid weekend at the box office, with earnings surging before a drop on Monday.

Kanu Behl's Agra denied shows: 46 indie filmmakers demand fair access to theatres After Kanu Behl's latest release 'Agra' got limited screenings, a joint statement from 46 independent filmmakers was issued that criticised India's theatrical and OTT systems.

Chiranjeevi blames piracy for box office losses of Game Changer, OG Actor Chiranjeevi highlighted how piracy impacted box office performance of major Telugu films such as 'Game Changer' and 'OG', following the arrest of the alleged iBomma website operator by Hyderabad police.

Boney Kapoor lauds PM Modi's vision during visit to Statue of Unity: Truly a marvel Boney Kapoor visited the Statue of Unity and called the experience a "dream come true," praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision behind the monumental creation. His trip comes shortly after the filmmaker celebrated his 70th birthday with a warm, intimate family gathering.

Anil Kapoor congratulates Tom Cruise on honorary Oscar: An award you richly deserve Actor Anil Kapoor extended his congratulations to Tom Cruise after Cruise was bestowed with an honorary Oscar at the Governors Awards, highlighting the friendship between the two actors, who previously worked together in 'Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol'.

Jesse Eisenberg speaks on RRR and Indian fans of Now You See Me films: Read here Jesse Eisenberg praised SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' in his first India interview, saying "every American saw that movie" and calling it incredible. He also expressed gratitude for the strong Indian fanbase of the 'Now You See Me' franchise as he promotes its latest installment.

Rajamouli's atheism and the God question: Can a non-believer create epic tales? SS Rajamouli's declaration that he is an atheist has sparked a fierce backlash from sections of the audience who expect belief to define a filmmaker's right to tell mythological stories. Here's why faith and storytelling are not bound by the same rules.

Gigi Hadid quits alcohol to support Bradley Cooper's sobriety journey: Report Gigi Hadid has reportedly quit alcohol to support Bradley Cooper's long-standing sobriety as their relationship becomes more serious. Sources say Hadid is fully committed to Cooper's lifestyle, embracing his "sobriety journey" as a core part of their partnership.

Is Brad Pitt's F1 sequel coming? Director Joseph Kosinski shares a big hint Director Joseph Kosinski has confirmed that discussions are underway for a possible sequel to Brad Pitt's blockbuster 'F1', following the film's massive global success. With 'F1' becoming Apple's highest-grossing release ever, both Kosinski and Apple CEO Tim Cook have hinted that a second installment is strongly being considered.

Cynthia Erivo breaks silence on Ariana Grande fan scare at Wicked: For Good premiere Cynthia Erivo has addressed the frightening moment when a fan accosted Ariana Grande at the 'Wicked: For Good' Singapore premiere, reflecting on the emotional week both actors endured. She spoke about the film's deeper themes and how the experience strengthened their bond as co-stars.

Tom Cruise gets honorary Oscar at Governors Awards: Shows our shared humanity Tom Cruise received the Academy Honorary Award at the Governors Awards and delivered an emotional speech celebrating the unity and transformative power of cinema. He reflected on his childhood love for movies and how filmmaking has shaped his identity and journey.

Bigg Boss 19 Episode 86: Ashnoor breaks down after father's question on weight The 'Bigg Boss 19' episode on November 17 saw tensions among housemates give way to emotional family reunions as the Top 9 contestants experienced the start of family week.

Priyanka Chopra takes fans behind the scenes of Mahesh Babu's Varanasi event Priyanka Chopra shared exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpses of the grand 'Varanasi' event at Hyderabad. The celebration featured a dramatic title reveal of SSMB29, with performances and heartfelt moments that captivated the audience.

Man who attacked Ariana Grande at Wicked Singapore premiere gets 9 days in jail The intruder who attempted to grab Ariana Grande at the Singapore premiere of 'Wicked: For Good' has been sentenced to nine days in prison. The film will release on November 21.

Delhi Crime 3 team on 8-hour shifts: Actors unfairly blamed for delays 'Delhi Crime 3' cast and crew spoke about the difficulty of sticking to an 8-hour workday in the industry. They stressed the need for a fair balance while noting that makeup and prep time are essential parts of filming, not extra hours.

general news.headline: Suicide bombing very misunderstood, says Red Fort bomber in unseen videoIn the unseen footage, the Red Fort bomber talks about the "misunderstood" concept of suicide bombing. He explains that what is often labelled as a suicide bombing is actually a martyrdom operation in Islam.

Red Fort blast terrorists had planned Hamas-style drone attacks in Delhi: SourcesThe NIA's probe into the Delhi blast revealed that the accused initially planned rocket bomb and drone-based explosive attacks across high-security zones and were seeking technical experts to execute the plan.

Both BJP, JDU vie for Speaker's post ahead of Bihar government formation: SourcesBoth the BJP and JD(U) are pushing for the Assembly Speaker's post as their leaders meet in New Delhi to finalise the structure and key portfolios of the new NDA government in Bihar.

Why is Sheikh Hasina branded as criminal and not Muhammad Yunus: Taslima NasreenExiled Bangladeshi author Taslima Nasreen has called out the International Crimes Tribunal's death sentence for ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, questioning why chief advisor Muhammad Yunus and his aides haven't faced similar scrutiny after last year's student uprising that toppled Hasina's regime.

Video: Man with knife charges at cabbies at Bengaluru Airport, caught after chaseA man was arrested for attempting a knife attack on taxi drivers at Kempegowda airport late Sunday night. CISF's quick action prevented a major crime and ensured safety at the airport.

Gavaskar backs Gambhir: Pitch fine. India batters lacked technique, temperamentIndia vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar backed Gautam Gambhir's defence of the Eden Gardens pitch after India's 30-run loss in the first Test. His stance came even as former cricketers, including Cheteshwar Pujara and Harbhajan Singh, labelled the surface far from ideal for Test cricket.

ED raids Al-Falah headquarters, 24 other sites amid probe into Delhi blast caseThe ED has also registered a PMLA case over financial irregularities involving the Al-Falah University, where the Red Fort bomber Dr Umar un Nabi and others accused in the Jaish-e-Mohammad-linked Faridabad terror module worked.

1,000 km/day: Tiny Indian Falcon stuns scientists with marathon flightThe tiny bird covered an astonishing 3,100 kilometres in just 76 hours, an aerial marathon that saw him slice across central India, glide past Gujarat, and skim out over the Arabian Sea.

Maruti Suzuki e Vitara review: Is this the right EV at the right moment?The e Vitara is Maruti Suzuki's quiet step into an electric future, and we drove it a month before its India debut. Not to chase lap times or lightning bolts, but to understand whether this unassuming SUV can translate everyday simplicity into genuine EV maturity. Surprisingly, it nearly does.

Tear gas, batons, clashes: Bangladesh on boil after Sheikh Hasina verdict, 2 killedTwo were killed as massive clashes broke out in several parts of Bangladesh, including capital Dhaka, after the ICT's death penalty ruling for for ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina for crimes against humanity during the students' uprising in 2024.

6 months on, Pakistan still repairing damage from India's airstrikesIt has been over six months since India and Pakistan engaged in a four-day war, yet Pakistan has not been able to repair the damage inflicted by Indian forces on its vital installations. OSINT expert Damien Symon's revelations of repairs at the Nur Khan Airbase poke big holes in Pakistan's claims of victory against India in the May conflict.

DRS: Did Gautam Gambhir make the right choice with a rank turner in Kolkata?Gautam Gambhir's decision to request a rank turner at Eden Gardens has sparked debate after India's 30-run defeat. The DRS panel weighs in on whether the strategy suited the team's strengths or exposed its limitations.

Rajamouli's atheism and the God question: Can a non-believer create epic tales?SS Rajamouli's declaration that he is an atheist has sparked a fierce backlash from sections of the audience who expect belief to define a filmmaker's right to tell mythological stories. Here's why faith and storytelling are not bound by the same rules.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Iran ends visa-free entry for Indians; New Delhi warns of job fraud, kidnappingsThe latest decision marks a major shift in the country's travel policy, which earlier allowed Indians to travel to the country without obtaining a visa, in an attempt to strengthen diplomatic ties.

You're applying for IPOs. But are you funding growth or just promoter exits?The IPO market looks hotter than ever, but the rise of OFS-led offerings reveals a trend most retail investors rarely pause to examine. In Part 2 of The Great IPO Gamble series, we break down what's changing beneath the hype.

Naina Avtr: India's first AI actor debuts in micro-drama'Naina Avtr', India's first AI actor, was introduced by Avtr Meta Labs. The AI actor now stars in the micro-drama titled 'Truth & Lies'. She appears alongside human actors on the show.

Sholay's original ending: The climax India never saw, and reason it was scrappedAs 'Sholay' returns to theatres in a restored 4K version, audiences will finally see the film's original ending that never saw the light of the day. Here's what was in the climax and why it was scrapped.

Burdened with voter list revision work, Jaipur teacher dies by suicideThe 48-year-old teacher, identified as Mukesh Jangid, had written in a note recovered from his pocket that he was under pressure from a supervisor over official tasks linked to the SIR scheme.

Cognizant to monitor employees, laptops will be termed idle post 5 mins breakIT giant Cognizant is reportedly cracking down on its employees with stern monitoring systems. Those with no activity on their laptops for five minutes will now be marked 'idle'. The company will use a tool called ProHance to put this into effect in a gradual rollout.

Little boy dances to Hrithik Roshan's Janaab-e-Aali as classmates cheer in viral videoA video of a little boy dancing to Hrithik Roshan's popular track 'Janaab-e-Aali' from War 2 has delighted the internet.

In Bastar, ex-Naxalites swap guns for coffee cups as Chhattisgarh CM opens cafeChhattisgarh's Bastar region is witnessing a remarkable transformation as former Naxalites now run a café in Jagdalpur, symbolising peace and rehabilitation. This initiative highlights the shift from conflict to stability through skill development and community trust in Indian English.

Gujarat officer kills wife and 2 children, buries them, then files a missing caseAn Assistant Conservator of Forests in Gujarat murdered his wife and two children, buried their bodies, and then filed a missing persons complaint with the police. He has now been arrested.

Rank turner haunting: When India didn't learn from mistakes during home TestsThe Indian team management's decision to go for a rank turner in Kolkata backfired as South Africa secured a historic win in the first Test. But this wasn't the first time this plan has backfired for India.

Salman Khan and family at Salim-Salma's 61st anniversary, actor greets paps. WatchSalman Khan joined family members and close friends to celebrate the 61st wedding anniversary of his parents, Salim Khan and Salma Khan, in Mumbai on November 17.

Piyush Mishra slams Bollywood's unnecessary entourage culture, praises south cinemaPiyush Mishra criticised the growing trend of actors travelling with oversized entourages in Bollywood, calling it unnecessary and burdensome. He praised the South film industry for its humility and simplicity, recalling how even top directors like Shankar treated him with respect.

sports.headline: Russell's KKR release wrong, even 4 players like Cameron Green can't cover it: Kaif Mohammed Kaif has claimed that Andre Russell's release from KKR is wrong and said that four Cameron Greens won't be able to fill the void left by the all-rounder. Russell won the IPL twice with KKR during his 12 seasons with the team.

Germany, Netherlands secure World Cup 2026 qualification with big wins Germany secured World Cup 2026 qualification with a dominant 6-0 victory over Slovakia, finishing top of Group A. Netherlands also confirmed their place in the tournament, remaining unbeaten and defeating Lithuania 4-0 to top Group G.

Smithy's mind was racing: Starc on Hazlewood-Abbott injury blow during Shield tie Mitchell Starc revealed the chaos that ensued after Josh Hazlewood and Sean Abbott had to leave the field during the Sheffield Shield match ahead of the first Ashes Test against England. Both Abbott and Hazlewood are ruled out of the match in Perth due to injuries.

After Cairo bronze, Esha Singh aims Asian Games: Want to bring glory to my country Esha Singh made history by winning her first individual senior world‑championship medal, a bronze in the Women's 25 m pistol at the ISSF World Championship in Cairo. In an interview with Sports Today, Esha talked about doing well in the Asian Games next year.

Sri Lanka Cricketers Return From Pakistan Amid Illness And Security Jitters Over Islamabad Blast This report covers the sudden return of Sri Lankan cricketers, captain Charith Asalanka and pacer Asitha Fernando, from their tour in Pakistan after falling ill. The development occurred amid heightened security concerns raised by the Sri Lankan squad following a recent suicide bombing in Islamabad. The bulletin states, 'The players recalled for medical care as Sri Lanka cricket avoids specifying nature of illness'. This precautionary decision was made to ensure the players receive proper care and have sufficient time to recover.

Rank turner haunting: When India didn't learn from mistakes during home Tests The Indian team management's decision to go for a rank turner in Kolkata backfired as South Africa secured a historic win in the first Test. But this wasn't the first time this plan has backfired for India.

Will South Africa bring back Kagiso Rabada for Guwahati Test? IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada didn't play the Kolkata Test, but will the Proteas bring him back for the Guwahati Test with a chance to win a Test series on Indian soil after 25 years?

DRS: Did Gautam Gambhir make the right choice with a rank turner in Kolkata? Gautam Gambhir's decision to request a rank turner at Eden Gardens has sparked debate after India's 30-run defeat. The DRS panel weighs in on whether the strategy suited the team's strengths or exposed its limitations.

FC Barcelona return to home stadium Spotify Camp Nou: First match decided Barcelona will finally return to the renovated Spotify Camp Nou after more than two seasons away. Their La Liga clash against Athletic Bilbao marks the first match at the revamped stadium since 2023.

Sunil Gavaskar on Eden pitch row: Blame India's batting, not the wicket for defeat On this special report, Indian cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar weighs in on the controversy surrounding the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test match loss to South Africa. Gavaskar defends the wicket, aligning with Indian Head Coach Gautam Gambhir, and argues that the focus should be on the Indian team's batting performance rather than the pitch conditions, highlighting South African captain Temba Bavuma's resilient innings as an example to follow. When asked about the pitch, Gavaskar stated, 'I don't think it was a pitch where you get all out for 90 runs like the Indian team did.' He firmly places the responsibility on the batters' temperament and technique, suggesting they failed to apply themselves correctly during the chase.

Am I Harmanpreet Kaur? Bangladesh captain launches brutal attack on India skipper Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty dismissed allegations of assaulting junior players and took a veiled dig at Harmanpreet Kaur while defending herself. In 2023, Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy during the Bangladesh tour.

In 2023, Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy during the Bangladesh tour.

Sri Lanka's Asalanka and Fernando return before Pakistan tri-series: Cite illnessSri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka and Asitha Fernando are returning home from Pakistan due to illness. Sri Lanka Cricket clarified the exits are unrelated to security concerns following the recent Islamabad blast.

Leave the curator alone: Sunil Gavaskar's clear verdict on Eden Gardens pitch rowIND vs SA: Former India captain, Sunil Gavaskar believes teams should never interfere with a curator's work after India's Eden Test defeat. He says pitch manipulation can backfire and urges trust in the curator's expertise.

India's Spin Gambit Backfires; Gambhir's Test Coaching Under Fire After Proteas LossThis special report analyses India's 30-run Test match defeat to South Africa at Eden Gardens, a loss that has put coach Gautam Gambhir's red-ball record under scrutiny. The programme delves into the controversy surrounding the spin-friendly pitch, which the Indian team management reportedly requested, and features sharp analysis from former captains Sunil Gavaskar and Sourav Ganguly on the team's batting collapse and overall strategy. Sunil Gavaskar stated, 'It is just poor technique and poor temperament, which has got us into this situation.'

Watch: India, Pakistan players shake hands in Women's T20 World Cup for the BlindIndia and Pakistan players shared a rare handshake after their T20 World Cup for the Blind clash in Sri Lanka, breaking the no-handshake trend that had followed recent encounters between the two sides.

WPL 2026 set to be held in Mumbai, Baroda from January 7: ReportsThe WPL 2026 season is expected to be split between Mumbai and Baroda from January 7 to February 3, with DY Patil Stadium likely to host the opener and Kotambi Stadium set for the final. The auction will take place on November 27.

India should have chased 124 in Eden Gardens Test vs South Africa: Sunil GavaskarIndia legend Sunil Gavaskar believes the hosts should have comfortably chased 124 in the Eden Gardens Test. He said the loss highlighted batting lapses rather than pitch conditions or external factors.

Sourav Ganguly Advises Team India to Play on Good Pitches and Win Tests in 5 DaysThis special report delves into the intense debate over India's Test cricket pitch strategy, featuring analysis from former India captain Sourav Ganguly and cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar. The discussion addresses whether India should prepare turning tracks from day one or opt for good batting pitches that last longer, following a recent loss on a spin-friendly wicket. Sourav Ganguly, the current President of the Cricket Association of Bengal, offered his advice, stating the team should 'win test matches in 5 days, not in 3 days'. The programme explores the differing philosophies, with Gavaskar suggesting curators should be left alone to prepare balanced surfaces, while Ganguly advocates for playing on good pitches against all opponents to build a resilient team.

His stance came even as former cricketers, including Cheteshwar Pujara and Harbhajan Singh, labelled the surface far from ideal for Test cricket.

Sourav Ganguly, the current President of the Cricket Association of Bengal, offered his advice, stating the team should 'win test matches in 5 days, not in 3 days'. The programme explores the differing philosophies, with Gavaskar suggesting curators should be left alone to prepare balanced surfaces, while Ganguly advocates for playing on good pitches against all opponents to build a resilient team.

India batters lacked technique, temperamentIndia vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar backed Gautam Gambhir's defence of the Eden Gardens pitch after India's 30-run loss in the first Test. His stance came even as former cricketers, including Cheteshwar Pujara and Harbhajan Singh, labelled the surface far from ideal for Test cricket.

Eden curator responds to criticism of pitch after India's shock lossIND vs SA: Eden Gardens curator Sujan Mukherjee defended the much-criticised pitch after India's two-day defeat to South Africa, saying he simply followed instructions and stood by his preparation.

Former India player calls out Rishabh Pant's captaincy in Eden Test loss: Needed GillMohammad Kaif highlighted Rishabh Pant's on-field decisions as a key factor in India's Eden Test defeat. Shubman Gill's injury absence and another batting collapse added to India's problems in the loss to South Africa.

Who is Laila Hasanovic? Jannik Sinner celebrates ATP Finals win with girlfriendJannik Sinner celebrated his ATP Finals triumph by sharing a warm moment with girlfriend Laila Hasanovic after defeating Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets. Despite the win, Alcaraz still finished as year-end World No. 1.

Ashes: Big boost for Australia as fit-again Pat Cummins bowls full tilt in PerthPat Cummins returned to full-intensity bowling, giving Australia a boost ahead of the Ashes, even though he remained ruled out of the first Test. In his absence, Brendan Doggett is set for a historic debut.

Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, though 2nd Test participation remains in doubtIndia captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital after a neck injury. His participation in the second Test remains uncertain, but he will travel with the team to Guwahati.

Fear under Gautam Gambhir: Ex-player makes big claim after Kolkata Test shockerIndia vs South Africa: Former batter Mohammad Kaif said batters in the current Test team are playing with fear for their places and a lot of insecurity. He alleged that the Gautam Gambhir-led team management has not been backing the batters enough.

India should not have all-format captain, split captaincy is smart move: MukundFormer India opener Abhinav Mukund believes India should not have an all-format captain and that split captaincy is the right move for Indian cricket.

East Bengal begin AFC Women's Champions League with strong 3–1 win vs Bam Khatoon FCEast Bengal opened their AFC Women's Champions League campaign with a solid 3–1 win over Bam Khatoon FC. The result gives them an early boost ahead of their next clash against defending champions Wuhan Jiangda.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
